Package ohos.data.orm

Interface OrmContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public interface OrmContext
extends AutoCloseable
    An interface provided by the object relational mapping (ORM) system for operating ORM database entities defined in OrmObject.

    Applications can use this interface to create, retrieve, update, and delete database entities.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    OrmObject
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Data#DATA_APPDATAMGR

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        <T extends OrmObject> boolean insert​(T object)
        Inserts an object to the database.

        After this method is executed, data changes are stored in the memory. You need to use OrmContext#flush to save the data changes in a database file.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates the object type, which is restricted to subclasses of OrmObject.
        Parameters:
        object - Indicates the object to be inserted.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the object is inserted; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • update

        <T extends OrmObject> boolean update​(T object)
        Updates an object in the database.

        After this method is executed, data changes are stored in the memory. You need to use OrmContext#flush to save the data changes in a database file.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Restricts the results that belong to the specified OrmObject.
        Parameters:
        object - Indicates the object to be updated.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • delete

        <T extends OrmObject> boolean delete​(T object)
        Deletes an object from the database.

        After this method is executed, data changes are stored in the memory. You need to use OrmContext#flush to save the data changes in a database file.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Restricts the results that belong to the specified OrmObject.
        Parameters:
        object - Indicates the object to be deleted.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • where

        <T extends OrmObject> OrmPredicates where​(Class<T> clz)
        Creates an OrmPredicates instance.

        You can use this method to restrict the class of objects to be operated. To perform more specific database operations, use OrmPredicates.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates the type of clz, which is restricted to subclasses of OrmObject.
        Parameters:
        clz - Indicates the class of the objects to search.
        Returns:
        Returns the created OrmPredicates instance.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • query

        <T extends OrmObject> List<T> query​(OrmPredicates predicates)
        Queries OrmObject instances that meet the conditions specified by the OrmPredicates instance.

        You can use OrmPredicates to limit the operation range. Conditions contained in the OrmPredicates instance must be compliant with SQL statement logic.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates the type of elements in the returned list, which is restricted to subclasses of OrmObject.
        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates the predicates that contain the match conditions.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of the queried instances; returns an empty list if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • query

        ResultSet query​(OrmPredicates predicates,
                String[] columns)
        Queries results that meet the conditions specified by the OrmPredicates instance and returns the results based on specified columns.

        This method supports cross-process query.

        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates predicates that contain the match conditions.
        columns - Indicates the database column names.
        Returns:
        Returns the result set; returns an empty ResultSet instance if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1

      • delete

        int delete​(OrmPredicates predicates)
        Deletes OrmObject instances that meet the conditions specified by the OrmPredicates instance.

        You can use OrmPredicates to limit the operation range. Conditions contained in the OrmPredicates instance must be compliant with SQL statement logic.

        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates predicates that contain the match conditions.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of objects deleted; returns 0 if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • update

        int update​(OrmPredicates predicates,
           ValuesBucket value)
        Updates information in ValuesBucket to a specified OrmObject instance based on the conditions specified by the OrmPredicates instance.

        You can use OrmPredicates to limit the operation range. Conditions contained in the OrmPredicates instance must be compliant with SQL statement logic.

        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates predicates that contain the match conditions.
        value - Indicates the map that caches a row of data. The keys should be the column names and the mapping values.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of objects updated; returns 0 if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • count

        Long count​(OrmPredicates predicates)
        Queries data that meets the conditions specified by the OrmPredicates instance and returns the number of the matched data records in a specified column.
        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates predicates that contain the match conditions.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of matched data records; returns 0 if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • max

        Double max​(OrmPredicates predicates,
           String field)
        Queries data that meets the conditions specified by the OrmPredicates instance and returns the maximum value of the matched data in a specified column.

        If no data meets the conditions, this method will return 0. Conditions contained in the OrmPredicates instance must be compliant with SQL statement logic.

        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates predicates that contain the match conditions.
        field - Indicates the column name.
        Returns:
        Returns the maximum value of the matched data in the specified column; returns 0 if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • min

        Double min​(OrmPredicates predicates,
           String field)
        Queries data that meets the conditions specified in the OrmPredicates instance and returns the minimum value of the matched data in a specified column.

        If no data meets the conditions, this method will return 0. Conditions contained in the OrmPredicates instance must be compliant with SQL statement logic.

        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates predicates that contain the match conditions.
        field - Indicates the column name.
        Returns:
        Returns the minimum value of the matched data in the specified column; returns 0 if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • avg

        Double avg​(OrmPredicates predicates,
           String field)
        Queries data that meets the conditions specified in the OrmPredicates instance and returns the average value of the matched data in a specified column.

        If no data meets the conditions, this method will return 0. Conditions contained in the OrmPredicates instance must be compliant with SQL statement logic.

        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates the predicates that contain the match conditions.
        field - Indicates the column name.
        Returns:
        Returns the average value of the matched data in the specified column; returns 0 if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • sum

        Double sum​(OrmPredicates predicates,
           String field)
        Queries data that meets the conditions specified in the OrmPredicates instance and returns the sum of the matched data in a specified column.

        If no data meets the conditions, this method will return 0. Conditions contained in the OrmPredicates instance must be compliant with SQL statement logic.

        Parameters:
        predicates - Indicates the predicates that contain the {code sum} conditions.
        field - Indicates the column name.
        Returns:
        Returns the sum of matched data in the specified column; returns 0 if no data is matched.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        OrmPredicates

      • flush

        boolean flush​()
        Writes unsaved data changes into the database.

        This method is generally used after OrmContext#insert, OrmContext#update, and OrmContext#delete to write memory data into a database file.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the memory data is written into the database; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • beginTransaction

        void beginTransaction​()
        Begins a transaction in EXCLUSIVE mode.

        Here is the standard idiom for transactions: ormContext.beginTransaction(); try { ... ormContext.commit(); } catch (RdbException e) { ormContext.rollback(); }

        Since:
        1

      • commit

        void commit​()
        Commits a transaction.

        See beginTransaction() for notes about how to use this and when transactions are committed and rolled back.

        Since:
        1

      • isInTransaction

        boolean isInTransaction​()
        Specifies whether the object is in a transaction.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the object is in a transaction; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • rollback

        void rollback​()
        Rolls back a transaction.

        See beginTransaction() for notes about how to use this and when transactions are committed and rolled back.

        Since:
        1

      • getAlias

        String getAlias​()
        Obtains the storage alias related to the current database context.
        Returns:
        Returns the storage alias.
        Since:
        1

      • changeEncryptKey

        void changeEncryptKey​(byte[] newEncryptKey)
        Changes the encryption key of an encrypted object-relational mapping (ORM) database that is opened.

        This method applies only to an encrypted ORM database and cannot be used to change it to an unencrypted one. Before calling this method, ensure that the database is opened and that no transaction is using the database connection. For the maximum size of the encryption key, see OrmConfig#MAX_ENCRYPT_KEY_SIZE.

        Parameters:
        newEncryptKey - Indicates the new encryption key of the ORM database.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the new encryption key is null or an empty string.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the database is not opened or not encrypted, or a transaction is using the database connection.
        RdbException - Throws this exception if changing the encryption key of the encrypted ORM database fails.
        Since:
        3

      • close

        void close​()
        Clears the memory data and releases the store. A context is no longer available after being closed.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Since:
        1

      • backup

        boolean backup​(String destPath)
        Backs up the current database to a specified path.
        Parameters:
        destPath - Indicates the path for backing up the database.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the database backup is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • restore

        boolean restore​(String srcPath)
        Restores data from a specified database file.
        Parameters:
        srcPath - Indicates the path where the database file is stored.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is restored successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • backup

        boolean backup​(String destPath,
               byte[] destEncryptKey)
        Backs up a database in a specified path using a specified encryption key.

        The generated backup is encrypted. If destEncryptKey is null, the generated backup is unencrypted. In that case, this method is equivalent to the OrmContext#backup(String) method. For the maximum size of the encryption key, see OrmConfig#MAX_ENCRYPT_KEY_SIZE.

        Parameters:
        destPath - Indicates the path that saves the database backup. Ensure that your application has write permissions to this path.
        destEncryptKey - Indicates the encryption key of the database to back up. It can be different from that of the current database.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the database is backed up successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • restore

        boolean restore​(String srcPath,
                byte[] srcEncryptKey,
                byte[] destEncryptKey)
        Restores a database from a specified encrypted or unencrypted database file.

        When being called, this method deletes the original data and generates an encrypted or unencrypted database, as defined by your application. If both srcEncryptKey and destEncryptKey are null, this method is equivalent to the OrmContext#restore(String) method. For the maximum size of the encryption key, see OrmConfig#MAX_ENCRYPT_KEY_SIZE.

        Parameters:
        srcPath - Indicates the path that stores the source database file. Ensure that your application has write permissions to this path.
        srcEncryptKey - Indicates the encryption key of the source database. If the database is unencrypted, set the value of this parameter to null.
        destEncryptKey - Indicates the encryption key of the restored database.If you want the database to be unencrypted, set the value of this parameter to null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the database is restored successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • registerStoreObserver

        void registerStoreObserver​(String alias,
                           OrmObjectObserver observer)
        Registers an OrmObjectObserver object to listen for changes in the storage specified by its alias.
        Parameters:
        alias - Indicates the alias of the storage to be listened.
